subject: Productivity
title: Why Bad Habits Persist
description: A 60-second lesson on Why Bad Habits Persist.

hook.text: You swear off junk food every Monday. By Wednesday the chips are back. What went wrong?

buildup.text: Bad habits persist because the brain never truly deletes a learned loop. It only overlays new ones.

discovery.text: The original loop stays dormant, waiting for the right cue and enough stress to reactivate.

twist.text: Motivation fades but neural pathways don't. That's why willpower alone rarely wins long term.

climax.text: The key isn't erasing the old habit. It's building a stronger new one on top of it.

punchline.text: You can't delete a habit. You can only overwrite it.

quiz.question: Why do bad habits persist even after we try to stop them?
options: The brain never fully deletes learned habit loops
Bad habits are caused by genetics alone
